head.title: At G-8 Meeting, A Familiar Song

hedline.hl1: At G-8 Meeting, A Familiar Song

block.p: Your June 7 editorial ''Looking for Leadership'' should make us all hang our heads in despair.
Your June 7 editorial ''Looking for Leadership'' should make us all hang our heads in despair.

In the early life of our nation, with a population of just under four million, we produced leaders like Thomas Jefferson and George Washington. Today, with more than 300 million people, the best we can do is George W. Bush and Dick Cheney!

However important climate change might seem to some, it pales in comparison with current world problems that we can't solve, including the lack of safe drinking water for tens of millions of people, abject poverty that cripples tens of millions in Africa and elsewhere, overcrowded urban slums, millions of childhood deaths from simple diseases that are easily controlled, and widespread hunger and malnutrition in a world of plenty.

Our leadership focuses on making life better for the rich, concentrating wealth, provoking wars, destroying the environment and aiding big business at the expense of the rest of us, who feel powerless. It hauls this mantra to the Group of 8, thinly disguises it when possible, and fumbles every pass that other leaders throw its way. Sad, indeed!
Gary Peters Paso Robles, Calif. June 7, 2007
